So github is a little funny about that
If you push the source branch before you've pushed a master branch, it treats the source branch as the default branch, and looks at it for webcontent instead of the master

As for the why. that's a Github pages thing. For user pages, they require that the compiled site live in the master branch. They use the data there to serve up the web content
